title: Lesson 1 Quiz: Actions Are By Intentions

questions.question: According to the hadith, what determines the value of an action?
choices: How big or public the action is
questions.explanation: The Prophet ﷺ taught: actions are judged by intentions, and everyone gets what they intended.

questions.question: In the migration example, why was one person’s migration considered for Allah and His Messenger?
choices: Because it was more far away
Because his intention was for Allah and His Messenger
questions.explanation: The hadith shows the same action can differ in reward based on intention: for Allah vs. for worldly reasons.

questions.question: What does the lesson say Allah looks at first?
questions.explanation: Allah looks at your heart before He looks at your actions.

questions.question: If you do a good deed mainly to be seen and praised, what is the outcome?
choices: You get full reward from Allah
It counts as worship no matter what
questions.explanation: Doing good for show brings only people’s praise. Real reward depends on sincerity for Allah.

questions.question: Why did many scholars place this hadith at the beginning of their books?
choices: It’s short and easy to memorize
To remind readers that intention comes first
questions.explanation: Scholars wanted to emphasize that the intention is foundational—without it, actions lose value.

questions.question: Which Qur’an message aligns with this lesson?
choices: Islam is about sincerity and worshipping Allah alone
questions.explanation: Qur’an verses in the lesson stress sincere worship of Allah alone—not for show.

questions.question: What dangerous habit can quietly destroy good deeds?
questions.explanation: The lesson warns about riya’—doing good deeds to impress people instead of pleasing Allah.

questions.question: Which everyday check helps keep sincerity?
choices: Ask: ‘Who am I really doing this for?’
questions.explanation: The lesson’s practical advice: pause and ask who you’re doing it for—make it for Allah.

questions.question: Pick the sincere intention for praying:
questions.explanation: Prayer is sincere when done because Allah deserves worship—not for people’s eyes.

questions.question: Which statement best summarizes the lesson’s key takeaway?
choices: Actions matter even with wrong intentions
Intention transforms normal actions into worship
questions.explanation: Your intention is what turns everyday actions into worship and brings reward from Allah.
